title: Building and Exploring National-wide Enterprise Knowledge Graphs for Investment Analysis in an Incremental Way

author: Zhijia Fang, East China University of Science and Technology (ECUST)

segmentation: Good morning everyone.

This is Georgia phone from is China University of Science and Technology and this is joint work with Shanghai High Knowledge, information technology, corporations and the main author to run could not come to this conference for her own visa issues.
I just help her to present this paper and I will try my best to explain it well to all of you and anyone who are interested in this papers could email the authors after conference.
Thanks all.
And before I talk about the details, how we construct this enterprise knowledge graph, I want to say something about the business motivations in China.
Most securities companies provide investment bank service and investment consulting services.
In the past, these services are usually for those big companies.
And in recently in the year 2013 with the establishment of the new surfboard, a national share transfer system for small and medium sized companies was declared.
Small innovation companies has the opportunity to be listed on this board with the endorsement of securities companies.
And in this background, securities companies have served to, uh, have served found those big enterprises to those small and medium sized companies.
And in fact that there are over about 14 million companies in China.
It is really difficult for these securities companies together or Senate and full fledge in formations of these potential and potential and customers.
So in this paper we built the Magic Mirror, which is also called the enterprise Knowledge Graph.
The target is we want to help these securities companies to know and to approach their target companies better and quicker.

So in this knowledge graph we have 200 million entities, 1 billion attribute value pairs and 200 million relations and it took us one hour to extract entities, 3 hours for the attribute value pairs, and three hours for extract relations from arise sources.
And currently we update this Knowledge Graph once a month, which I think is really simple at the current time and needs to be improved in the near future.

And we sell this knowledge graph as services instead of sell selling the whole softwares and the securities companies could customize this Knowledge Graph portal and integrate it into their own applications.
We ask for our customers to pay by times of API access per year.
And we provide several services, including general querying and graph visualization services and in depth analysis.
All these services I will give an examples to in the following slides.
And here I want to say something about the when we bought the challenges.
When we construct this Knowledge Graph first comes to the business challenges.
As we all know, data privacy is an important issues.

Be cause when we need to provide that deep and useful services without violating the privacy of both the company and their employees, and the 2nd is we should provide some killer services on the graph becausw since our Knowledge graph is really big and it the users will be overloaded with too much information if we just deliver the raw data to them.
In the besides comes to the technical challenges when we design the data models.
There are a lot of different types data needs to be resolved, such as a sequential range and my tab.

And when we extracted information from the website, there are a lot of entity operations in the raw text Ann for the query in performance we encountered performance bottlenecks since the number of triples in our knowledge graph which reached billions.
So here I want to introduce what is the enterprise knowledge graph.
It is designed as an ontology call structures, which is which is.
Which is divided into the schema graph and the data graph, and we have the following components in this knowledge graph.
The concept.
The properties.
Relations.
Metal.
Properties.
An honoree relations.
And we have four major sources to construct this knowledge graph, namely the Chinese.
Securities administrations, which is an RDB and the second one is a patent website.
We collect informations about 5 million pattern formations from this website.
And the second is an RDBMS from Chinese government procurement networks.
It provides informations of the listed companies and finally is the encyclopedia website.
And how we choose how we resolve it, source how and what data can we get from these sources?
First, the database from the Chinese State Administration for Industry and Commerce contain informations about the directors, shareholders and general managers.
We.
Trance more transform.
These are DBS into RDF to form the basic knowledge graph.
And then comes to the pattern website.
We can.
We can crawl data from this website and it it can investigate.
We can investigate a company's technology advantages from this website.
We also extract attributes and values of attribute value pairs and convert them into RDF triples to form a patent knowledge graph.
And finally comes to the encyclopedia website.
We extract the attribute value pairs of stock from this website to convert them and convert them into triples.
And the whole process could be listed on the slide.
First we design the schema.
Then we do that.
The two are transformations, which is mainly transform the data from RDBMS to RDF.
Then we extract information from several possible websites.
And then we do the data fusions to construct the fine.
No enterprise knowledge graph.
When we do the schema designs there are it, it could be considered as two extractions.
While most general knowledge graph such as the DB Pedia Jago was built in a bottom up manners.
In this paper our enterprise Knowledge graph is adopt.com top down approach.
Which means that when newly data set is come to our knowledge graphs, we will manually designed or extend existing schemas.
And the second it comes through for accounts to the Detroit transformations.
There are a lot of difficulties in this step since we have, the RDB is collected from the government and these data tables are usually integrate, found from multiple data sources.
What is mean?
This data tables usually do not follow the standard designs of data tables, and some tables may even contain multiple entities, relations or even.
General relations and what's worse is in the same table may refers to different entities or entity relations.
So we introduce a techniques which is, namely the table splittings.
Its goal is to split the original tables virtually into some smaller ones named automatic, entity and relation tables, and those complex ones.

And the for those simple ones, we can directly use the Detour tools which we used in this paper is called D2 RQ which is a well known tools and we write customer customized mapping files in due to our Q2 Maps.
These relations and entities into RDF.
And the force those complex ones we write special programs to deal with the following issues, namely meta property mapping, conditional taxonomy mapping, and conditional class mapping.
And when we do the extractions from the website.
We have several major data sources needs to be fixed.
Charts
And we our target has our target data has multiple types.
Such as map list range.
Binary relations or even events or phenomena extractions the details of the information extractions has been introduced in the following paper, which is published in the last years just conference.
And we have the data we need to do the data Fusion work, and since we manually designed the schemas, we only focus on the instance matching in this step.
We adopt A graph based entity linking algorithm to encounter this problems and we build an undirected graph.
To complete this aggregation step.

And here I want to say something more about our storage design and query optimizations first for the storage designs, we designed our own triple stores on top of the Tokyo MX, which is an open source distributions of a well known database Mongo DB and also we used in memory database radius to store the data which are heavily accessed and Secondly we implement.
Arise datatypes on top of token Max including list.
Range and map tab.
And the third we store meta properties and their values in different columns, which we called it white column tables.
And for the and also we optimize the query performance.
First we construct 9 indexes which is shown on the figure.
And also we also index the matter properties.
An early relations as well.
Secondly we catch the schema definition table and class hierarchy definition tables in radius.
And the second.
We designed, we found that the design of white column table is really efficient.
And with the property and the matter properties are retrieved together with one only one operations.
And this operations could be done on the database level.
And finally we petitioned the triples into different tables according their own data types.
And after I introduced the whole process of constructions, I need to give an interesting examples of how our customers use this magic mirror or the so called enterprise Knowledge Graph.

Supposing that the ideas and investors who hears about a company named Long Credit and it is a companies on Big Data Area and the investors wants to know the detailed information to support his own invest decisions in the futures and he comes to us and they use the Magic Mirror.
First, he wants to know some general overview of about the companies and we provide services.
He from the pictures he can.
Learn the financial status and innovation strength of long credit.
According to the KPM audio we provide.
And then we use several tables and a graph to illustrate the result, which we think is more friendly to the end users.
And after reading this result, the investors found that this this company is quite satisfactory's and he wants to go go to some details about it.
So Secondly he used our graph query services.
First, I want to illustrate I want to explain the result in this figures long credit dump.
The company is the center note of the figure.
And the right circle circle represents the executives of the company.
And those green circles represent the enterprises.
And these red lines represent the employment relationships between executives and the company.
Anna.
Those green lines represent the investment relationships.
So the investment could conclude that.
The long credit has six investors invest in 11 companies and have 10 executives.
And now he wants new then important indirect and direct shareholdings of the companies.
So he used the pedigree analysis of our systems.
First, the investors can find that there is opposed persons who is both an investors and executives of long credit.
Since he has multiple relations, ships with long credit, both he and quite long credit have Co invested in a number of companies.
We can conclude that this person is an important persons of this company.
And the second the investors found another companies who who is a listed companies in China and he has focused on the software and network technologies.
And he is actually an indirect invested company of long credit and an interesting things is that long credit has claimed that it has developed big data solutions on many industries.
Recent recently and it seems that.
Long Credit is one of its important important arrangements in the future.
And the third the investors found that there is a company whose names start from tax.
It is very promising that things taxing is one of the most important indicators of current operation status of the enterprise, and the company may utilize this data in the futures.
So according to all of the above information, is the investors may conclude that the long credit is fairly good at the Curragh.
Stage.
And so he can use the real controllers services to find the most important person of long credit.
And also he can use the past discoveries.
To find the shortest path among the concerned companies.
And here I want to conclude this papers.

This paper is mainly focused on building an enterprise knowledge graphs and in the futures they plan to add some more data sources such as the tax invoice and invoice information and also he want they want to monitor the change of shareholders as well as rituals of companies and also develop some interesting applications such as control intention recognitions toward the current controllers of the company.
And thanks all.
Thanks for the talk.
Very, very interesting.
I'm just wondering if you could say something about data quality, whether there was an issue at all for you guys.
And the data quality is that the data they collected is mainly from the government and they have the data quality is quite good 'cause the government data is usually cleaned at the current time.
And never quite Frank.
Thanks for the talk.
Another question, did I understand well that you have designed my own schema for representing all the data?
So did you publish this schema and did you?
Why did you not reuse existing schema for presenting this sort of information?
And The thing is that the schema is privacy becausw the data sources we use our meaning from the government.
So what the Knowledge Graph should be privacy at the current time and the data sources is limited with when we build the Knowledge Graph.
So we designed schemas manually, yeah, but just schema explained that the company's shareholders and managers and things like this.
So this part which is quite agnostic from the real instances.
Don't you plan to publish this schema?
I think it could be useful for over similar scenario.

I think publishing the schema is quite good and if it's open to the public, many other companies which do the same things to us may be helpful to them and I will talk about the implementers when I come back to China.
I think it is a good idea.
